intro: Rinorea kimiloloensis, commonly known as the Kimilolo rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
